title.value: Novel community data in ecology: properties and prospects
title.quote: Novel community data in ecology: properties and prospects

extractions.description: This paper discusses how novel community data generated through technologies like eDNA, acoustic sensors, and optical sensors are transforming biodiversity monitoring. It reviews emerging solutions, particularly focusing on statistical methods for analyzing these new types of data, such as joint species distribution models, and explores new ecological questions and implications for policy and conservation.

type.justification: The paper predominantly reviews developments, emerging solutions, and theoretical implications of novel community data in ecology.
type.quote: Here, we review these developments and highlight emerging solutions, focusing on statistical methods for analyzing novel community data, in particular joint species distribution models; the new ecological questions that can be answered with these data; and the potential implications of these developments for policy and conservation.

name.justification: The paper's main focus is on ecological and environmental data, monitoring, and theoretical implications for biodiversity conservation.
name.quote: Understanding the factors that govern the distribution of Earth's biodiversity across space and time remains one of the most important and challenging problems in biodiversity science.

name.justification: The paper focuses on advancements in technologies like eDNA, acoustic sensors, and more for biodiversity monitoring.
name.quote: New technologies for acquiring biological information such as eDNA, acoustic or optical sensors, make it possible to generate spatial community observations at unprecedented scales.

name.justification: The paper places a significant emphasis on the use of advanced statistical methods for data analysis, particularly joint species distribution models.
name.quote: Here, we review these developments and highlight emerging solutions, focusing on statistical methods for analyzing novel community data, in particular joint species distribution models.

name.justification: The implications of the novel community data on policy and conservation are explored in detail.
name.quote: and the potential implications of these developments for policy and conservation.
